intro: Corunastylis ruppii, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its compact, grass-like foliage and striking, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
